Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Ambiance, & Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: johnsdeere
Reviews.Content: We purposely chose the Sorrento Hotel due to it's location to the hospitals and clinics (only one block away) and our clinic recommended them. We loved the overall ambiance and charm that this building and it's decor provided. The fact that we could have our beagle/lab mix dog stay with us was a huge reason as well for staying here. For such a nice hotel the ($60 one time fee) for our stay was well worth it to us to bring our dog. The beds.....oh the beds...lovely, with all the plush pillows and comforters......we slept great and even took a nap. Rather than using the valet parking for the night ($39 per night) we chose to park right across the street since we have a large F250 pickup and paid for 24 hours only $20 dollars where the machine accepted either cash or debit. I highly recommened the Sorrento and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Huehuetenango
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sorrento directly through the hotel website. Got an excellent price for our 3 night stay. The staff was great, starting off with the concierge who let us know before we arrived that a hotel car was available to pick us up at the ferry, saving us the cost of a taxi. Very friendly and helpful front desk staff made sure everything was satisfactory. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice perk. Some minor quibbles: like in many other old hotels, the bathroom was small; we were on the second floor above the entrance and noise and unwanted light were problems (we had to keep the bathroom door closed to keep out light but were unable to close the drapes in the bedroom) and there is an underlying odour (more in the halls, less in the rooms). Overall an excellent stay, however.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class service in beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandHills
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business in the Sorrento for one night and experienced the Fireside Room for the 1st night and then again prior to leaving Seattle late on the last night. From the time I arrived at the hotel, I was met with 1st class service where nothing was too much trouble. Their guys at the concierge were magic - they knew where to recommend restuarants and bars then even offered to drop us off and also pick us up after we did some shopping - rather then get a cab back to the hotel. Great location in the heart of the city. Friendly people, gorgeous hotel and the Fireside room is just lovely when the Seattle weather is not so great, food was fabulous and winelist recommendations were spot on. This is a true gem, understated elegance and professional warm genuine service. I wish I could've stayed longer than just a night.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: fardog1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just pent 4 nights at this beautiful hotel. The service was very friendly and accommodating. We had a junior suite that was perfect in size, comfort and decorating. I highly recommend this hotel. The food at the Hunt Club was very good and we ate at the bar as the restaurant was empty.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: osser
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible travel day getting here, but the staff at the Sorrento is amazing. Hotel and room are beautiful, luxurious and comfortable. Staff is so kind and it is obvious that they enjoy working here. This is what a hotel SHOULD be!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff/Location and Great Old World Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Truly pleased with all aspects of this hotel. A bit of the old world, dark rooms and antique furniture/decor. The staff is extremely helpful and genuine. The room ( 1 br suite) was beatiful, terrific showers! I will stay here again! Also very close to the Swedish Med Center for my business-Close to Pike Place and the finance disctrict as well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Tibbygirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Seattle. I looked around for hotels and this one stood out as it had great reviews, a fantastic location, and great rates. It lived up to all the reviews. It was a beautiful hotel and room. Our bed was super comfy and the room had wonderful touches with a book shelf and wet bar. The hotel feels like you stepped right back into the 1920s. And the location is fantastic!! Within walking distance of several of the great neighborhoods - we never had to take a cab. Also, we ate dinner at the Fireside Room our first night there and it was wonderful. The crab cake was divine! I will definitely stay here the next time I visit Seattle and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Return to the Sorrento”
Reviews.Author: Mogs60
Reviews.Content: Peerless! The mature charm of the Sorrento has made this our hotel of choice when visiting Seattle. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. The staff is most pleasant and accommodating. The hotel restaurant and bar are quite exceptional. Live entertainment was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again and again”
Reviews.Author: jazger
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel located near Seattle Univerisity and Pill Hill. I stayed here alone for two nights, and loved it. The staff were very warm and generous. A glass of wine was waiting at check in, hand the rooms were clean, well appointed, and the beds comfortable. It is an old hotel, so the elevator is small (which is charming) and the plumbing a little slow to bring up the hot water (which is a shame as they must waste a lot of water.) They have a restaurant which I did not go to because it was more a meat lovers place. But the lounge was quiet and comfortable. I sat by the fire and ordered wine and read and just had a wonderful time all by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm, new world service”
Reviews.Author: dancergal
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a family wedding. The couple chose The Sorrento as one of two in which they had blocks of rooms (the other was the Four Seasons). I had several questions in the weeks before the arrival, and the staff was always very knowledgeable and helpful, making dinner reservations for me the first night at the Hunt Club, and arranging for transportation back to the airport (I had made my own arrival arrangements). The car service they offer was a great help. Reservations can only be made the day you need the car, but both Friday and Saturday I was able to book the car for two trips each day (morning and afternoon, not evenings). On Friday, they figured out for me where a courthouse was located. The drivers were always prompt and friendly. You can call for a pick-up to return to the hotel, but not book a return. If the car is available, they will come get you. I used cabs or rode with friends and family on my return trips. I also used the safety deposit boxes, which are available 24/7. There is no private room, you access your box directly at the front desk. The room key is electronic, but rather than being a key card, it resembles a flash drive, and has a rather large tag on it. The combo of the tag and the key itself made it too large to fit into an evening purse. I don't know the purpose of the tag as there was neither a room number nor the hotel name on it. The key itself would've been small enough to fit in my purse. The Beauty Bar which is shown as being in the hotel is actually a spa at the Fairmont Olympic a few blocks away. I used them for a make-up session before the wedding as I was to be in formal family pictures that night. The Hunt Club was a bit noisy, with music playing from overhead speakers. When being seated, I asked to be moved away from an overhead speaker and they accommodated me. At my new table there was a group of 6 older guests next to me who because of hearing problems and issues with hearing aids were having great difficulties conversing. When they brought the problem to the attention of the hostess, they were moved to an adjacent room in the restaurant where it was much quieter, which I thought was a nice touch. I had a problem with the flapper valve in the toilet not closing properly the first day, but when I called to report it, it was fixed within two hours. Pretty good! Others have mentioned issues with the HVAC system. It is the older kind, controlled by a unit under the window, with no thermostat, just different fan speeds and and dial for warmer or cooler temperatures. It took a bit of experimenting, but I was finally able to adjust it to my satisfaction. However, I would suggest at their next renovation that they upgrade to a thermostat system. A small quibble was the location of the full-length mirror, which was hung in the darkest corner of the room, next to the walk-in closet, so the door to the closet blocked the mirror when it was opened. Even with all lights on and with light from the windows (not much from the windows in gray, rainy Seattle!), it was difficult to see. I suggested to them that it be hung instead inside the very large walk-in closet (almost a small room), which is very well lit. I had requested a room on the side of the hotel away from the main entrance and the hospitals nearby. I don't know if it was just a quiet weekend, but I never heard a single siren from ambulances. Wireless internet service was free and had a very fast connection. For breakfast and lunch I ate at the Corner Cafe across the street, which has very reasonable prices and the food is quite good. You also can buy bakery items there (breakfast rolls and cookies). I thought both breakfast and lunch were a bit overpriced at the hotel. There really are no restaurants suitable for dinner within walking distance of the hotel, but there are many a cab ride away either in downtown or up on Capitol Hill. As my Friday and Saturday dinners were part of the wedding celebration I never tried any of them. If you plan on walking down into town, be aware that Seattle is notorious for the steepness of the hills coming up from the water. Many of the buildings on 1st thru 4th Avenue actually have elevators that make a stop at 2nd Street as well as the 2nd floor, etc., as a consequence.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was pure perfection start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: StephG639
Reviews.Content: Check in (with Jackie) was wonderful. She was welcoming and very kind. Our room was so comfortable and homey. We felt like we were in a luxurious home. Decor beautiful and elegant. Sheets were silky perfection. All of the bedding and towels fresh and clean. Bed perfectly comfortable. Wonderful nights of sleep. Much needed as we were in process of moving from AK to VA. The Sorrento was the perfect respite for us during the long transition. Love the charming, historic feel of the hotel but all of the modern luxuries are there. Take a look at the book in the lobby about the history of the hotel. Interesting especially if you like history. The valet parking staff was excellent. Alex and Cody were prompt, attentive, and very informative. My only suggestion for the hotel is to offer some vegan meal options on their room service menu.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: outdoorjo
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento served as our Seattle home base for the weekend. We were within walking distance to downtown, given some wonderful restaurant suggestions from the concierge, and enjoyed live music each night in the hotel's lounge. They offer a car service to anywhere within 2 miles of the hotel, so they picked us up from dinner one night too. The beds were comfortable, rooms spacious, and bathrobes soft. Can't say enough about how accommodating the staff was, and how personalized our experience was; we were greeted by name when we returned to the hotel throughout the weekend, and it was very welcoming. Also, the lemon drops were a perfect refresher and sweet treat at the reception desk! We will definitely return to the Sorrento when we're in Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: Northwestlady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times because of the hotel's proximity to medical facilities and it is such a welcome respite. The staff is just wonderful and always accommodating from the front desk to housekeeping. Their beds are just wonderful and I always sleep better than at home. I love the french press coffee in the rooms along with the extra thick towels and bathrobes. The furniture is starting to show wear a little, but is still comfortable. The fireside room is a wonderful place to unwind and the bar is a true classic that is hard to find these days with its warm, wood interior and always incredible bartenders and wait staff. This is my favorite hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMKuzma
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The service was fantastic, the decor charming, the prices very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday in Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: April7055
Reviews.Content: A friend took me to the Sorrento's Fireside Room for drinks on one of my visits to Seattle, so I knew I wanted to stay there when I visited again. This time, I met my sister from Montana (I'm from California) for a three-day weekend for her January birthday. We both loved the vintage feel, character, and elegance of the 100-year-old hotel. The Fireside Room, where we had wine each evening, paneled in original mahogany and filled with comfy furniture is warm and inviting. Our birthday dinner in the hotel's Hunt Club restaurant was excellent, and the waiter remembered to put a candle in my sister's dessert as I had requested earlier. Our room with two queens was fresh and lovely, the beds, loaded with pillows, wonderfully comfortable. The staff was friendly and efficient, especially the maintenance man, who fixed our TV channel problem immediately, and concierge Kody Kidd, who quickly answered all my pre-visit questions. If you like a smaller, historic hotel, a warm, friendly atmosphere, and elegant accommodations, you'll like the Sorrento. I'll go back for sure on my next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service - I will stay at the Sorrento again”
Reviews.Author: hooverdam4
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Hotel exceeded my expectation in every way. From the moment I checked in I knew this was going to be a lovely visit. It is so nice to stay at this hotel. The concierge/driver staff ensured I reached my destination in time for my meeting. The bell staff was excellent. The front desk staff was friendly. Additionally, I loved that the hotel staff emailed me a head of time to ask for any preferences and more importantly, they honored my requests. The room was lovely. I also appreciated that the hotel manager followed up with me to ensure my stay exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ed L
Reviews.Content: I recently stated at the Sorrento Hotel in downtown Seattle and found it to be a wonderful European style hotel. The front desk and bell staff were superb. They helped me with my transportation needs to a dinner meeting and extended my checkout time so that I could leave my belongings in the room until after the funeral Mass I was attending at the Cathedral. The restaurant served a wonderful breakfast and the server was friendly and met all my expectations. I can highly recommend this hotel to any traveler looking for a great European style hotel that is neat, clean and has excellent service. Ed Little, President/Principal Seton Catholic College Preparatory

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old charm hotel with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: SYD-YYZ
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with old charm. Staff charming and very helpful. The few times I tried to use the complimentary town car was unsuccessful. The shower temp is temperamental - hot showers in morning and cold showers at night even when max temp is chosen - lucky it was not winter. Whilst lovely I probably will choose to stay elsewhere next time as It is uphill from downtown and it's too quirky for my liking. Also housekeeping does not clean well - there is a toilet stain that was left for few days. It looks like they only made my bed each day and not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and well-located”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento feels a bit different to the hotels I've stayed in recently; more characterful. Whether that's because the room keys are actually shaped like keys, rather than swipe cards, or because the carpet in the lift changes every day to inform you what day of the week it is, or that the whole place is decorated like it's still the 19th century, I'm not sure, but it's a change. This can be both good and bad. Because the electrical supply to the room isn't controlled by putting a card in a slot, you have to go and turn lights on and off individually, and when I arrived the room was quite chilly because the heater wasn't on. But then why waste power unnecessarily heating a room when it's unoccupied? The lights aren't as bright as I'm accustommed to, but then you get free wifi, which is always a decent thing to have. Bathroom and shower are very good; bed also, although I was awed that there were so many pillows on it. There's an embarrassment of televisions: a huge flatscreen in the living room and another in the bedroom. Staff were all very friendly: the concierge was very helpful finding me a barber and you generally felt very at home. The area around the hotel felt a little bit scruffy to me, but as it's winter the streets are devoid of anyone, so there's nobody to encounter that might make you feel threatened. I suppose Seattle in January may not be the best time to walk around outside in the hope of encountering people. Facilities are good - there's a decent restaurant (Hunts) and the gym in the basement is spacious and has some good equipment. All in all, a most pleasant stay for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: Trix79
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent older hotel with great architecture, comfy beds and friendly staff. My wife and I stayed here the other day and were very impressed. The staff (particularly John) were extremely professional and courteous. We stayed in a junior suite which was nice and spacious for two people. We also dined in the Hunt Club downstairs, which featured a fantastic selection of wines. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with people that make you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: pajiko
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Christmas Eve, enjoyed dinner in the Hunt Club and live jazz in the Fireplace Room before going to Midnight Mass at St. James Cathedral, about 2 blocks away. The room was well maintained, clean and comfortable. It has all the charm, and a few of the expected shortcomings (smaller rooms, bit noisy) of an older hotel, but nothing I would call a problem. I did not use the fitness center, but the hotel does have one, something I could not find listed on their website. The best part of our stay was the friendly staff. We were looking for a taxi during the morning checkout rush. In the midst of this very busy scene, one of the valets (Rob?) took us to the bus station in the hotel car. We also enjoyed excellent service in the restaurant and lounge. The staff at this hotel are the reason we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley Place”
Reviews.Author: Carlaleeanne
Reviews.Content: Took my husband here for "date night" and had a very nice, romantic stay at this historic hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful! The staff members were friendly and efficient. The accommodations were clean, comfortable and charming. Our favorite was the fireside room! If you choose to stay at this hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to spend our anniversary at The Sorrento Hotel in December. His company had arranged for dinner in the Hunt Club restaurant at the hotel so he thought it would be lovely to spend the night at the hotel. We had stayed there two years prior and remembered it as having a warm and lovely ambiance. Our room was comfortable and well-designed. We were greeted with a small bottle of wine, salted chocolate caramels (yummy) and a lovely note congratulating us on our anniversary. The coffee was delicious - prepared with a coffee press with detailed instructions provided. Only two "flies in the ointment": the room was too warm and I could not find a way to turn down the heat (in the middle of the night and not thinking clearly to phone the front desk). Also my husband had booked the room one month ahead and we found out later that other members of our party who stayed the night as well, paid less for their package and were upgraded upon arrival. The hotel's response to this was to say that we got what we paid for and that it is their discretion to chose to upgrade upon arrival. My husband had also requested a corner room (we didn't get one), but another member of our party received one and they arrived after us and had not requested one. Hard to understand how hotels work. However, I would return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Home”
Reviews.Author: RobertS_10
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Hotel is my first, and generally only, choice for accomodation when I am in Seattle. To stay anywhere else would feel like 'cheating'. The Sorrento is very comfortable - both the rooms and the public spaces. Staff turnover is very low and it is always nice to be recognized and greeted by name when returning. The staff remember guests' details and quirks and seem genuinely interested in doing their jobs well. This hotel is a quiet, intimate oasis in the midst of a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with modern ameneties”
Reviews.Author: AKwanderer77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sorrento for 2 nights in mid-November of this year. We had a room with a king sized bed that smelled very clean. The bathroom is smaller but very classy and clean. Besides, how much time are you spending in there anyway. The bed was super comfortable with nice bedding. We used the free wifi quite a bit to research restaurants - it was nice and fast. All the staff was very helpful and friendly. One of them recommended a great, family run Indian restaurant in Capitol Hill and another offered to return a hotel key we accidently took from our previous hotel in Queen Ann on his way home. There is only one small elevator but it never was a problem even though the hotel was full. We used the courtesy car a couple of times but mostly walked everywhere, even at night. Yes, the hotel is on a hill but all of Seattle is on some hill or another. If you are an active person walking to and from the hotel should be no problem. We also utilized the light rail to get to and from the airport and used the public buses. We took in some of the live jazz music in the lounge over a few cocktails. Keep in mind those cocktails don't come cheap. The lounge area had a nice fire going and is a beautiful, old, wood paneled room. Over all a great experience. If you are looking for a cool, older hotel that has been lovingly maintained over the years this is your place. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Night away at the Sorrento”
Reviews.Author: dobie397
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sorrento this past weekend as a night away while seeing a show at the 5th Avenue Theater. Nice drive and lovely lobby; all decorated for Christmas. Everyone we encountered was very helpful and friendly. We had a Junior Suite, which was nice enough, but I don't think I'd choose it again. Having the room chopped into two small rooms made the whole space seem tighter. Interesting pictures above the bed: drawings of nudes, one of which was a chunky man sitting down with one well-defined nipple. :) Nice bathroom, but I wish the door opened to the left as the door was completely in the way if you were using the sink. It's definitely an old hotel and I thought I smelled an "antique" odor in the room, but it wasn't too bad. It was extremely noisy outside of our room like machinery was on for most of the night. I was able to sleep, but it was very noticeable. There are nice touches like the carpet in the elevator reflects the day of the week. Nothing much in the immediate area; there is a cafe across the street, but we didn't try it. Unfortunately, when we arrived back at the hotel at 11pm Saturday night there was an intoxicated person sitting on the curb in front of the cafe beginning to heave...not that this effected our decision to find another cafe. I have other hotel's in Seattle I enjoy more for room and location so I don't think I would choose the Sorrento again, but I do not regret staying here and would recommend it for people looking for a cozy stay in an old-world hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Early Christmas at the Sorrento”
Reviews.Author: WestVanDebbie
Reviews.Content: We have been going to The Sorrento Hotel for many years over the American Thanksgiving holiday. We love their Christmas decorations, old world charm and live jazz music in the evenings. Their rooms have lovely bedding and are very comfortable and well appointed. Drinks before dinner in the bar is also fun, appitizers are very good. They have a town car which was always available. My only complaint is that the breakfast is only ok for the price - very average. The staff have been there for many years and seem to all get along and even remembered us. A fantastic weekend was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay @ the Sorrento Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 907Becky
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night but wished for more!. We had a small suite with a marble bathroom. The room was clean and smelled nice. We had 2 tv's, a desk, couch and chair in the seating area. There was a stocked fridge and some other items on the tv stand. We loved our bed and linens as well as the robes provided in the room. Best night of sleep that trip for sure. The room also had an iron and ironing board. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. The concierge staff was wonderful too! Drove us to Pikes Market for a hair appt and picked us up without delay. They also delivered us to dinner at the Metropolitan Grill too. We would have had a pick up as well, but wanted to walk off the dinner. We enoyed the wine at check in and the coffee in the lobby in the morning. We had an early departure and would have loved to take some time for breakfast as with all we had experienced, we could imagine the food to be amazing. Can't wait for a return stay!

Reviews.Title: “This is the nicest hotel I've in in many years - certainly in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: pegsdaughter
Reviews.Content: I loved the Sorrento Hotel. It has an old fashioned ambience - rightly earned given its history - with lots of beautiful wood paneling in the lobby and a wonderful arts and crafts fireplace mantel. Our room, actually a small suite, was cozy without being cloying or cute, with a comfortable bed complete with comfortable linens, which weren't too heavy, a pet peeve of mine. The bathroom was immaculate with no trace of mold, though both the toilet and shower were a bit balky, though the issues were quickly addressed by the staff. The staff well may be the best part of the hotel. They were professional, courteous and helpful, the very best staff I have ever encountered at a hotel in Seattle, and indeed at a hotel anywhere. We will definitely stay there next time we go to Seattle.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “A cozy gem in the heart of misty Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Dillon B
Reviews.Content: We arrived with an overwhelming crew, taking over most of the hotel, and Sorrento not only managed to deal they embraced us! The rooms have everything you need, the staff is awesome and the food is great. This group was nothing less than rambunctious and we were received and sent off with smiles. Whenever in Seattle look no further than the Sorrento!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Josie B
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel with wonderful ambience. The staff were exceptionally warm and always had time to chat and give some pointers on the local scene. The suite was lovely and had huge bathrooms! The whole experience was fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Boutique service, elegant charm”
Reviews.Author: Marcella P
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel incredibly gracious without being stuffy, which was great for a weekend spent with friends. From the minute I arrived I felt like I was with family. The front desk and concierge were so attentive to our requests, the bartenders were awesome, and the staff throughout the hotel were just the nicest, day or night. Besides the great service, this elegant spot was charming without sacrificing modern amenities -- the beds were so comfortable (I counted 8 pillows!), the bathrooms were completely renovated and sparkled with the look of Restoration Hardware, the Bodum french press set-up was perfect for waking up in a coffee town, and complimentary wi-fi everywhere in the hotel was key to getting work done when and where I wanted to. The Sorrento is now my go-to for any visits to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully cozy”
Reviews.Author: Ayana J
Reviews.Content: In my world, cozy is the highest form of praise for a space. The lounge, the bar, the restaurant, and the rooms all had that dialed. Classy, yet welcoming. Great service, but not overly formal. Not cramped, not cavernous. Just all around comfortable. Also, fresh ground coffee and a french press in the rooms! Great touch. I was there with large and exuberant bunch of friends and they handled us with aplomb. Definitely my top choice now of places to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel experiences I've had in a long time. The staff was incredibly friendly and attentive, the facilities are gorgeous, the beds are comfortable, and the location excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Pilar C
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous building, terrific staff and wonderfully comfortable beds (with lots of huge pillows)! The ambiance is sophisticated and tranquil. Anytime we chatted with staff they were absolutely helpful, polite and genuinely friendly (in Spanish AND English). Our stay involved a large group of friends and we were all accommodated superbly. Upon (early) check-in, we were even offered an upgrade on our room for a minimal fee to a huge suite we loved! Also, the location is very accessible. Our stay was fantastic and we definitely want to return to The Sorrento in Seattle soon.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Eric K
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome of the doorman to the perfect pillows to the crispy bacon, the Sorrento is warmth, comfort, and home-style all the way. I travel to Seattle regularly and have made this den my home away from home. If I am going to spend a night away from home, it better be worth it. In other cities, it's a question. At the Sorrento it's a given. On this particular trip I arrived with a large group of friends looking for a good time. While one hotel manager might have looked at us with concern, the Sorrento staff could not have been more welcoming. That, with the addition of their cultural programs such as Night School, actually made me sad at check out. The Sorrento owners and staff have made it feel like a home. And if I'm going to be away from mine, I'm feel right at home in theirs.

Reviews.Title: “Friend”
Reviews.Author: dsldsl
Reviews.Content: I managed to erase all of the music from my phone right before my flight except for a Nina Simone album, so I was in a perfectly elegant, classy mood to walk into the elegant, classy Sorrento Hotel last Friday. I love it! It has managed to maintain the look and feel of a gorgeous early 20th century hotel mixing in modern conveniences, and then topping it off with a wonderful friendly staff. Oh, and the rooms are HUGE with lots of light and the beds are *super* comfy. And its just a short walk to the waterfront, to the gaming arcade (guilty pleasure) and to a handful of local fine diners. Two thumbs way up!

Reviews.Title: “All about the details”
Reviews.Author: Ryan G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple nights last weekend. The food, rooms and staff were top notch. The design and style of The Sorrento made it feel like you're staying at someone's house from the 1900's, the details of the furniture and artwork create a vibe that's infectious and makes it's hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “They thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: Tyler W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sorrento last weekend and had a fantastic time. The staff had taken care of everything for us and was very accommodating to our requests throughout the weekend. We really enjoyed the decor, the location was a great jumping off point, and the lobby is a great setting for hanging out with a cup of tea when you're not out on the town. Add in a really friendly staff and you can see why I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously heading back to Seattle VERY soon!”
Reviews.Author: emily P
Reviews.Content: I’m not really a review person, but I felt compelled to write one for the Sorrento because frankly I hope they open one in every city around the globe! Even though there is much to explore in Seattle, I had a hard time leaving the cozy lobby of the Sorrento. With it's soft lighting and comfy couches, it’s easy to find yourself still by the fire- hours later-listening to someone playing the baby grand while sipping a glass of wine. My room was extremely spacious with big windows that you can actually open to get some fresh air, the bed was like a thick puffy cloud, and there were many tasty treats in the room. I'm looking forward to my return to the Sorrento Hotel very soon!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: Dan L
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the Sorrento Hotel is my absolute favorite hotel in Seattle. The staff is incredible, the lobby lounge is fantastic (loved conversations by the fireplace), location is perfect and the charm is unmatched. Whenever I'm in Seattle, this is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms + great staff = a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: I just spent three of the most amazing nights at the Sorento Hotel in Seattle. This was my second stay in Seattle and first at the Sorento. The staff was amazing. My room was large, roomy, and very clean. I'll definitely be staying at this hotel next time I'm in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Splendor in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: Alezandrar
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Hotel is a stunning sight and an even more stunning experience. The attention to detail is felt whether it is in the Fireside lounge with the roaring fire or whether it is at the bar having "Chad" prepare you a fabulous cocktail. The hospitality team were eager to please and eager to make my time in Seattle an effortless and wonderful time. The rooms were lovely and modern with enough room to dance around like you were in a penthouse suite. The luxuries and attention to detail are seen in the toiletries and the amazing rooms. My time spent at Sorrento was delightful and filled with fabulous warmth from the staff and the management team. I would encourage visitors of seattle to treat themselves to a fabulously warm experience filled with first-class accommodations on a friendly budget. I look forward to coming back and re-experiencing my recent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere In Time”
Reviews.Author: Khayyam W
Reviews.Content: Not only does the old world charm permeate through it's entire staff, it is a magical place that produces the fondest of memories. From the top to the bottom, this establishment impressed me, which is not easy to do. Aside from the aesthetic beauty, the real beauty lies with the employees and staff... exceptional to say the least. So warming that I left with new friends and a strong urge to come back for a weekend getaway. Top notch everything. Don't take my word for it, experience it for your self! Injoy! :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James F
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful hotel over the weekend. The moment you walk through the door you will be enchanted by one of the most beautiful hotel lobbies in Seattle. The inviting Fireside Room makes the perfect place to read a good book or drink a cup of coffee while you catch up with a friend. The room that I stayed in had one of the most comfortable beds that I have slept in. I usually have a rough time sleeping in hotels but slept like a baby. Many thanks to the hospitable staff for all of their hard work in making me feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep well, play well”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly P
Reviews.Content: A hotel with windows that open? Yes! For some reason, this small feature truly embodies luxury to me. That's actually almost all I need, but the Sorrento offers so much more. As someone with pretty bad allergies, traveling can be stressful, especially a hotel choice, as I never know what I'm going to find when I show up. Luckily, the Sorrento Hotel is a clean, beautiful, and breathable place to be. I was able to breathe, and sleep well. In fact, I longed for the mountainous and indulgent bed setting (do people say bed setting?) once I was back home and in my own bed. This doesn't happen. This is a first for me. The staff was incredibly responsive and kind. When I have a particular request at a hotel I often have trouble getting it answered. i.e. "Please don't clean my room, but just leave a new coffee press." often sounds like this to hotel staff: "Please...#&$&$ room, but #)(*#(@(." However, the staff responded to that and multitude of other requests with precision. Did I mention they have FRENCH PRESS in all the rooms? This is actually a historic hotel that was renovated, not a modern hotel made to look like a historic hotel. Therefore, the authenticity is truly authentic, and the beauty truly beautiful. I would cross my fingers that someone would sit down to play the piano as I walked through the lobby, and I enjoyed the food and classic (but well lit!) atmosphere of the Hunt Club. (I love windows.) You have everything you need in the hotel, but it's also walking distance to Elysian Brewery, Theo Chocolate, and other great sites. Warning, I like to walk. But, I will say Sugar Bakery and Cafe is literally a stone's throw away! And amazing! The Sorrento Hotel is a great experience, and if you end up there and something goes wrong, just ask, and the staff will be more than willing to help. That may be the best thing about the hotel, your ability, as a guest, to control your experience - while surrounded by luxury and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for magically weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole Patrice J
Reviews.Content: The staff is so accommodating with a smile! and goes out of their way to make every request better than possible.... It is amazing... a must stop!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, European-style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardhod
Reviews.Content: I always like a less-modern place which doesn't seem foursquare and predictable, and which has pianos for you to play AND free wifi, merging old and new neatly. The staff are friendly, courteous and helpful. The public areas are delightful and welcoming, affording good interaction among guests. Wood-panelling and human-scale design makes it a very pleasant place to be. The lift's old-school petite, and there's only one, adding to the charm, if not convenience. But they have a staircase and I prefer them for my health in any case, though it'd be better if they'd decorated it beyond some amusing paintings on each floor. Rooms are spotless, if small by modern standards, with restrained style, mid-quality furnishings, very comfortable bed, nice desk / chair, and lovely cushions. Bathroom is good, with openable windows, but no fan. Excellent soap and shampoo, which indicates they're trying to look after you. Hot water is at a premium, however, and having had two lukewarm showers in November, this is one major reason they don't get five stars. Although they had a free shoe-shining service, which is nicely traditional, and of which I availed myself. They hid the fridge in faux-drawers under the TV, and I missed it until I checked out! no wonder there were no ice machines (you ring to reception for ice) Room service menu looks good, if you need it, and my friends said it was very good. They have a gym but no pool AFAIK, but then you can always try a dip in the Sound! Delightful stay, and if you get a discounted rate, this is a good value hotel for a romantic break or a get-together of friends or colleagues. Being built in 1908, this place is quite antideluvian by American standards, and i shows here and there, but it's a very human place, friendly, and affords welcoming!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: JamesReilly
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three days at the Sorrento in Seattle and all I can say is WOW. Amazing staff, great vibe with a beautiful lounge and fireplace, and fantastic rooms. As someone who travels a ton, I would highly, highly recommend the Sorrento to anyone visiting Seattle. This is one of my favorite places I've stayed in quite some time, and any time I come to Seattle in the future this is the ONLY place I will stay! Why can't every hotel be like this one?

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Tonya W
Reviews.Content: From the time I pulled up to the door of the Sorrento Hotel until the morning I departed, I was immersed in old world charm. The staff were first rate, going above and beyond to make my stay as pleasant as possible. I stayed in a suite on the 6th floor--huge floorspace, comfortable bed, beautifully furnished and a bathroom with all the amenities. And the pillows....oh, the pillows. I will definitely stay here when I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Location, aesthetic and service”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the sorrento for the weekend recently. We arrived a couple hours before check in time but were checked in immediately and offered a very reasonable upgrade to a spacious corner suite on the 6th floor. The room itself was clean and comfortable with a complete entertainment system, 2 couches and a wet bar. They have managed to provide a modern vibe to a historic hotel. The hunt club restaurant was great, there were special events happening in the penthouse and inline music in the fireside room . Def Recomend this to anyone visiting Seattle

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, I stayed at the Sorrento and it was extremely pleasant. The staff was kind, rooms were clean and spacious, overall it was a great experience. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Warning! My review will hardly due this place justice...”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: Like the city of Seattle, where it resides, The Sorrento Hotel is a magical place that provides all the comfort, amenities and service a well traveled patron would expect, while still maintaining it's uniquely classic elegance and special charm, forged over a century ago. The beds are exceptionally comfortable, the location is central to many of my favorite Seattle spots, The Hunt Club serves amazing food and libations, the Fireside Room is the perfect place for a relaxing fireside chat and if you're lucky enough to be in town for "Night School," you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: SummitSeries
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Hotel was the perfect place to host a large gathering of business partners and friends. With access to the restaurant, the fireside room and the penthouse suite/presentation lounge, it was easy to convene, break into groups and get people fed. The real gem about this hotel though, is the access to Seattle's intellectual capital. The hotel has partnered with the creative genius that is Michael Hebb, who brings in incredible programming and music. We were honored to spend time with visionary Seattlites like Chase Jarvis, Lesley Hazelton, John Richards and Councliman Tim Burgess, as well as entrepreneurs from around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Adam G
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sorrento on the advice of a friend, which turned out to be priceless. The hotel pulls together a cozy atmosphere along with the quality of service and amenities of a luxury establishment. For example, when we were ready to party at 4am the concierge sent us to a couple of clubs that not even the locals knew about! Who knew Seattle had such a vibrant party scene :D The room itself was spacious, very clean, the bed incredibly comfy, the water perfect and the in room snacks delicious. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, please and more of that!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan R
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic weekend in Seattle and what a perfect hotel to spend it in! A classic case of old world charm meets new world panache, Sorrento hosted 100 great friends engaging in life, libations and language without a hitch. In fact, without a concern as well. I can't say enough about the staff, the rooms and the spirit. We believed in Sorrento and Sorrento believed in us. I now have my Seattle hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance, New World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Lauren C
Reviews.Content: I'm a classic girl. When I travel, I usually stay in private clubs or five-star hotels, and studiously avoid the trendy. A friend raved about the Sorrento, which I'd heard about via its intriguing cultural programming and "Night School" series, and when some us suggested a weekend to meet up there, I thought I'd give it a go. More than anything, it reminded me of the hotels I like in Europe, the sort of family-owned, off-the-beaten-path but always in the best locations kind of places one only ever discovers through word of mouth. Well here's a little secret for you: in Seattle, stay at the Sorrento. There's even a charming little book in the room detailing its history, as a Belle Epoque refuge in a tranquil setting that became the place to take an apartment for wealthy local families during the Roaring '20s. Much of this enchanted ambiance remains. Highlights? I enjoyed dinner in the Hunt Club, and the perfect cappuccino with the paper at breakfast the next day, a glass of wine by the fire in the main lounge, with its echoes of Timberline Lodge on Mount Hood, another of my favorites in the region (without the high-altitude dizziness here), curling up on six pillows on my bed to read in blissful silence with a view of a gargoyle standing guard on the roof outside, making a very civilized cup of tea in my room with Theo Chocolates from the well-stocked minibar... the list of memorable perfect touches goes on and on... I would encourage you to check in to the Sorrento and make your own. A perfect ten in my book; it gets its own chapter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for three nights at the Sorrento with a pretty large group of friends. The hotel staff were uniformly friendly. The beds were some of the most comfortable I've slept on and I travel about 50% of the year, so I know my hotel beds. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Extra!! Read all about it: Hotel Turns Into HomeTel.”
Reviews.Author: thinktony
Reviews.Content: Like a gorgeous chameleon, The Sorrento Hotel in Seattle, with all its heart, wisdom and glory of over 100 years, embraced and hugged our family of 200 and became home. They invited us to dinner, bandaged our wounds, tidied our rooms, and treated our hundreds of mischievous seekers and followers of humanity as well deserved children of a full maternal affection. And they let our best friends stay over for a slumber party. I live in gratitude of the service and love you provided me. I’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Classic old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie M
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay-- service was excellent, got upgraded to a suite for a very reasonable price, room was huge and bed was unbelievably comfortable. Only issue was with the temperature in the room-- couldn't ever get it quite warm enough. Shower was lukewarm as well. Not enough to stop me from returning, though!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: QuietTrave11er
Reviews.Content: We looked at a range of hotels in Seattle but settled for the Sorrento and are very pleased we did. From the moment of check in, the service was fantastic with John in particular worth a mention for a level of service of you would normally only get in Asia. The location is the only thing you sacrifice in this property but the rooms size (significant), free wifi and courtesy cars at your disposal a major plus compared to the peer group. We used the courtesy car 3 times and each times the driver was willing to give a little guided tour and insight. The only small negative is that the towels are over leaned and the odour of bleach on them needs getting used to but it is rare to say that the only downside was overcleaning!! We would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoonjunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Sorrento Suite" last January for 4 nights. I need to apologize for not writing this sooner as I promised the staff I would rave about the hotel on tripadvisor and have neglected to do so. The front lobby staff were very friendly and informative about the area. One day I wanted to go shopping and they called a town car for me at a fixed price comparable to a taxi but much more comfortable for the long drive to the mall I wanted to get to. The hotel is in the fashion of old world Italian charm and loaded with luxury, in the rooms and out. I was impressed with a change of carpet in the elevator every morning that told me what day of the week it was, a subtle and charming touch! Everything at this hotel was perfect except the climb up the hill from the downtown area. But it was worth the short hike to stay in such deluxe accommodations. This hotel excels in customer service and I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: LpLoLo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sorrento Hotel twice this month, Oct 9th for 4 nights, and again Oct 18th for 1 night. My husband had a surgical procedure at Swedish Hospital, about an 8 min walk from the hotel. In the mornings I would go to the Sugar Bakery (2 mins from the hotel!) on my way to the hospital...FABULOUS lattes, homemade pastries/scones/muffins and soup for lunch....incredible staff as well) I made the original booking over the phone and spoke to Trevor. I mention his name because he is amazing...always helpful, friendly, courteous, and very welcoming. We found all the staff, from the valet crew to the concierge to the front desk staff, the staff in the Lounge and the Hunt Club, to the few housekeeping staff I encountered, excellent, always greeting you with a hello and a smile on your way in or out. We were in Room 600, a JR suite and loved the room; clean, spacious, comfortable, nice bright bathroom, nice warm robes, big closet, and I really liked the desk where I used my laptop frequently. My husband's one night in the hospital became 2 and I felt safe and comfortable on my own in the room. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and so we returned again the next week for 1 o/night. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is charming and has such great history and character. Beautiful high-back chairs in the lounge, nice warm atmosphere in the lobby and dining room. It was a bit of a stressful time under the circumstances (my husband's operation), but we felt very comfortable at the Sorrento and enjoyed our time there. We will definitely go back and hope to get room 600 again! Having eaten in the Hunt Club the first visit, which was good, we decided to try dining out on the 18th, as it happened it was Seattle Restaurant Week...so we ate at Osteria La Spiga and took the hotel 'town car' there and back. The concierge highly recommended it. It was excellent as well, authentic Italian food and excellent service. I did a lot of walking from the hotel and it is an easy 20-25 mins walk to downtown and a nice cardio hill climb back up from 1st to the Hotel on Madison!

Reviews.Title: “Great two days @The Sorrento!”
Reviews.Author: Beck B
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were efficient and receptive. Found and drinks at the hotel Fireplace Room and The Hunt Club were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & Awful!”
Reviews.Author: momto7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic in so many ways. Check-in was a breeze as we were warmly welcomed. Upon inspecting our corner room, I saw that it was 2 double beds for our romantic getaway, which was not what I had planned. In a few minutes after calling the front desk, the clerk personally came up to accompany us to the same room 2 floors higher with a king bed--perfect! It was a suite but we have never seen such spacious hotel accommodations. The living room was huge & the bedroom oversized as well. The bathroom was tiny, but not a problem. We have a round window that opened from the shower & it was fun to open it a crack & watch the street below as I showered! However, the street below was a problem overnight because the Sorrento is 2 blocks from the Virginia Mason emergency room entrance where all the ambulances begin & end. I was awakened by sirens all night long, & this wasn't even over a weekend! That is the only negative aspect of our stay, but it's enough to keep me from going back. We ate in their restaurant which was outstanding. We frequently utilized their free shuttle service to the downtown area. It is also close enough to walk if you have the energy and time and aren't carrying a boatload of shopping bags. We did not need a car while we were there which meant we did not use the valet. The staff was outstanding in every encounter I had with them. The beds were great, the view isn't great, but the windows were large. And the interior of the hotel is just plain gorgeous. The coffee bar is very nice since we love French-pressed coffee & there is a small frig in the room as well. I only wish it was in a quieter location. I booked this stay through booking.com and was pleased to find that this did not affect how we were treated at all.

Reviews.Title: “A family member was suddenly taken ill and sent to Harborview Hospital”
Reviews.Author: travelwriter1usa
Reviews.Content: The tall dark haired front desk clerk was fabulous, very kind and helpful.The slender blond desk clerk the next morning was rude and condescending.The concierge Kody [...] was rude obnoxious and the worst concierge I have ever experienced while his assistant was fabulous and only about 18 years old. A few of the employees need customer service skills training but other than that every thing else was excellent.This is one of the most beautiful hotels in the world and it is just calming to be there especially in turbulent times.The management provided the hotels information to the hospital and we are so glad they did. We had a room with a round window in the bathroom the first time we stayed and then had a Junior Suite the second time. They were both so beautiful and the beds and linens soft and comfortable.This is one of my favorite hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is Absolutely Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: daneone
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Hotel in Seattle is a lovely 100 year old hotel. My requested for early check-in was honored and I found Trevor the desk clerk to be extremely accommodating offering two rooms for us to actually view. Our room classification was a Jr. Suite and we choose room 600, a corner room, well appointed and comfortable. I greatly appreciate Trevor providing room options and allowed us to actually look at the rooms. Really, how often does that happen when you check in? Almost never in my experience. This is something that hotels use to do years ago, and I personally appreciate it. Bathroom space is often a valid concern with older hotels, I did not find that to be the case with this room; however I will note hot water was a bit of an issue only in the evening. It took about five to seven minutes before the bath water got hot, but once you are aware of this you can easily adjust. I appreciate the bathroom having a night light and the rooms providing comfortable robes, which always saves valuable luggage space. There is coffee and tea in the room with a French Press. After reading the instructions and two failed attempts of preparing coffee I requested a standard type of pour through coffee maker for the room which was immediately delivered. The hotel has a complementary car to bring you, and pick you up upon availability and request. We used this service three times during our stay. Our driver the first day was Lance, who was very friendly. All of our drivers were courteous and friendly. I met with Alex the hotel Concierge the first day and he took the time to sit down with me and review various tour options and places of interest. Alex was very helpful, and I truly appreciated the time he spent with me. We only had one meal at the hotel in the Hunt Club. Dining reviews are very subjective. With that said, I am sorry to say that I would not recommend the Hunt Club. I did not find my meal or my husband’s to be what I would consider to be good, let alone outstanding. I would rate them as alright. The wait staff was excellent and attentive. The location of the hotel is in an area called “Pill Hill” you are up a very steep hill from the waterfront. You can walk to Pikes Market and downtown, utilize the hotel car or take a city bus, which is actually almost outside the hotel front door. We had absolutely no problem navigating Seattle from the Sorrento Hotel. There are some neighborhood dining options by the Sorrento. The Corner Café directly across the street, a bakery a few doors down from there. Across the street and down about two blocks towards the bay is “Georges Sausage & Delicatessen” – this place is only open until 5:00 but I made sure we stopped the day we were flying home and purchased two wonderful deli sandwiches that were absolutely great, and extremely reasonably priced, this is worth the short walk. About two doors down from there the 1st Hill Bar & Grill is located, we had dinner and breakfast, both meals very good. This is a neighborhood restaurant; George the original owner is friendly, walks around and visits with customers. One evening we dined at the Metropolitan Grill, which is about 6 blocks from the hotel, we had an excellent meal. I only mention these dining options because I personally find it helpful when reading reviews of what fellow travelers have experienced in the area. Also, if you are down at Pikes Market, there are many options for fresh fruit, bakery items, wine, wonderful things to bring back to your room. Probably the only real disappointment I found with the Sorrento was my request to print our Southwest Boarding passes. Anyone who flies Southwest knows the game, bring up the site, enter your information, minimize your screen and click as absolute close to the departure time as possible. Unfortunately I received the standard excuse, they were busy and detained and I got B-28-29 passes which afforded me the very last aisle seat in the very last row of the plane. I am more than aware this can happen and took the chance this task would be a priority, it was not. I just want to be sure you are aware of this and if it is important to you, I strongly suggest you make other arrangements than having the hotel do this for you. I want to thank the staff at the Sorrento, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. I specifically selected this hotel based on the comments posted on Trip Advisor. I also always book my reservations directly through the hotel. I would highly recommend the Sorrento to anyone considering it and I would definitely stay again. The staff at the Sorrento was absolutely, hands down outstanding and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: themidlifetraveler
Reviews.Content: Great place, very nice updated room and the most comfortable beds. Our room had a round window in the shower which opened to a nice view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: CindyCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite for 1 night in Sept. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Loved the lobby, velvet chairs, rich dark carpets, very warm and inviting. Great location, up from the market. Will stay again when visiting Seattle. Oh, and really appreciated the old style wood paneled elevator...classic.

Reviews.Title: “very nice historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ammark57
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights prior to cruise in a one bedroom suite, (separate bedroom / sitting area) well appointed and very roomy, comfy furniture and in keeping with hotel's persona, TV in both rooms, windows opening and overlooked main entrance way. Considering size of rooms bathroom was very small /compact. All very clean though. Some intermittent noise associated with location to local ER, and main road / hill adjacent. One small main lift is poor. Staff very friendly, couple of blips where explanations weren't given, for instance, courtesy car is available, up to a two mile radius, bookings only on the day. Also, complimentary continental breakfast with our booking, you are allowed to choose other things from menu and pay difference, if there is any. Nice to have on site bar and restaurant, missed out on jazz evening (weekend) but there was a 'block party' with entertainment, very lively. The courtesy car is not always available (previously booked) and the hotel is located on first hill !!! says it all, so be prepared for either good walks to and from the down-town area, or use taxi's, some pretty steep areas, thought I was back in San Francisco. Free wi-fi, got that right, tea and coffee making in room (not all hotels offer these) Good price and well worth it, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alta-Monza
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night before going on a cruise and thought the hotel was great. The welcome at reception was friendly, the concierge helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable as was the bed, everything just perfect. We even thought the location was ideal, as long as you like walking and are reasonably fit the hill is no problem, only took us 15 minutes to walk down to the monorail to go to the space needle. Vitos Italian just a couple of minutes down from the hotel doesn't look much from the outside but is nice inside and serves really good food. We definitely want to come back to see more of Seattle and the Sorrento is where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “A comfy night away”
Reviews.Author: AndreaRae13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sorrento for one night and I was very pleased with my experience. The room was fresh, clean and well appointed (the closet was huge!). I loved that the windows in the room and bathroom opened for me to get some fresh air. The staff was very accommodating and I had no problem getting the things I requested taken care of quickly and easily (early check in/late check out). I even got my dinner for the happy hour price even though I arrived right when HH ended, which was greatly appreciated. My only complaint is that my room's blackout curtains didn't close all the way, and it was quite bright in the room at night. (Also, and this is because I live in the 'burbs, there was a lot of street noise, even at night.)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eric M
Reviews.Content: I spent a great weekend at the Serrento Hotel in Seattle. After traveling all day across from the east coast, I was met at the door with a smiling face and at the front desk with courtesy a smile and efficiency. The room was clean, comfortable and the bed and all those pillows was a joy. The flat screen television with many channels was a treat as well. It is not a large hotel and getting was easy and the food in the restaurant was fantastic. The staff were pleasant helpful and had a smile on their face that just made even the rainy weather bearable. I highly recommend staying at the Serrento Hotel if you are going to be in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Charming with old world ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: Anne885
Reviews.Content: The Sorrento Hotel is beautiful and classy both inside and out. Our room was spacious and beautifully appointed. The only thing missing was a reading lamp next to the comfortable chair and ottoman. The doorman truly earned his tip in making our transfer smooth from the cab to our room. The lounge is wonderfully "old world" and perfect spot for relaxing with a drink. Everything about the Sorrento is first class. Also, it is nicely situated on the top of a hill and is within easy walking distance of downtown. We walked to McCormick Schmick for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: EddyEdster
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, lovingly preserved with impeccable service. In recent years we have been booking rooms in newer hotels, having been burned one too many times by historic properties that have not been kept up. The Sorrento has us back to realizing the joys of an architectural gem. Beautiful room and all of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. This location is a perfect fit for us - close to everything, but outside the thick of the action. We celebrated our anniversary and visited with friends in style.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to The Sorrento”
Reviews.Author: carolj265
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sorrento for three nights in July. While being a historically significant hotel, lovely decor, and the staff being friendly , its location is not good. Walking down hill to the market place and elsewhere is easy but walking back, up horribly steep hills, was a killer. The room we stayed in was very tiny and we heard ambulances all night long because a hospital is just a block away. Walking locally, it is situated in a neighborhood that we did not feel comfortable walking around safely. Their is a little diner type restaurant across the street which was excellent and very, very inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, everyone really friendly”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraGirl_11
Reviews.Content: Pros: everyone was extremely friendly and helpful, from the valet to the concierge. The rooms were clean, bed was very comfortable with wonderful, soft sheets. Nice toiletries. The lounge downstairs is beautiful, with a fireplace and comfy chairs. Breakfast was delicious (especially the smoked salmon eggs benedict). The hotel provides a car service, which is really nice, and the concierge booked us dinner reservations when we asked for a recommendation-it turned out to be exactly what we wanted. Cons: the hotel is a bit of a walk from downtown, 15 minutes downhill, 30 uphill, but if you're relatively in shape it's not a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rik1938
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night. The front of the hotel was beautiful aand very well kept. The valets were very polite and helped us right away. Our room was on the 5th floor and the veiw was great. The room was very clean and a nice size. The bed was one of the nicest that I have ever slept on. We used the courtesy car to go down to Safeco Field, which was a nice touch. In the morning was had breakfast at a small cafe across the street and it was pretty good. There is a restaraunt in the hotel, but we did not eat there. The only negitive about the hotel is the elevator, it is small and slow. This is understandable because of the age of the hotel. We will stay here again and reccomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “National Senior Tennis Tournament”
Reviews.Author: muldoonie
Reviews.Content: My four night stay at this historic/majestic property was WONDERFUL...! My room was large and beautifully appointed. The Staff was Friendly, well trained, and attentive to details. The location in downtown Seattle located on Madison Street was perfect as far as getting on and off the expressways. Free parking was a major plus. The 10:30 PM Happy Hour (half price on food and drinks) resulted in my timing my evenings around this feature. 'tis a GREAT HOTEL...!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: This is second stay at this hotel, which is very conveniently located near the heart of Seattle's medical district. Staff are very attentive and pleasant. Rooms are attractively appointed and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is like a grand old lady that has not lost it's charm”
Reviews.Author: IanWhiteUK
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sorrento, a classic hotel with great service from an era of elegance that resonates today

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandream
Reviews.Content: This classic hotel was great for our recent three-day visit. There is live jazz in the lobby/lounge area on weekends. Our suite was very large with a sitting room that could be closed off from the bedroom. The furniture was traditional and the room had lots of lamps and other nice touches like a bar area. The bathroom had a combined tub and shower with very good water pressure. Beds are comfy and have white linens. The hotel's car that shuttles to the downtown area was generally unavailable for us, which was the only downside of this hotel. It is on a steep hill, so walking to downtown attractions is difficult. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: mcleana
Reviews.Content: The service was great right from the moment we pulled up in the car with the valet service to the front desk. Our room was not ready so Trevor at the front desk gave us ideas for things to do in downtown Seattle. He circled places on a map they provide for you. We were upgraded to a nicer room on the top floor where we had our own balcony on the roof.The room was big with about 4 windows to let lots of light in. There were no black out blinds just sheer curtains so the light came in the room early in the morning. That was the only down side. As mentioned before by other people we liked how the carpet was changed in the elevator every day to reflect the day of the week. We also ate at the restaurant which was very good service and food. Although we were there at 7:00 pm and they were already out of prime rib.We would definetly stay there again on our next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Comfortable, Done with Good Taste”
Reviews.Author: Theresa355
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is classy without being stuffy. The rooms had all necessary amenities for a very comfortable stay, free wi-fi is a great help for getting work done & exploring the city, & the beds were unbelievably comfortable. I got 2 amazing nights of sleep and even wanted to take the bed home with me, but my suitcase was way too small :) The staff were all friendly & helpful even though we arrived at 1am, and very welcoming to our dog. We loved that you could open the windows for some fresh August air. This is a true piece of Seattle history, my mother ate prime rib at the restaurant here on her 21st birthday, 37 years ago, the best in town she said. We are so glad it is still here & seems well kept. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: rkilduff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at both ends of an Alaskan cruise. Service, rooms, and staff were great. The staff at the front desk and concierge desk could not have been more pleasant or helpful! They recommended restaurants, made the reservations, and transported us there. Not only that they provided complimentary appetizers as well. They even made sure we had a town car to take us to the airport at the same price as a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: marleenkok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. My husband bought the "shake & stir" package. this did proof to be a splendid package! Room, breakfast, martini's for two and valet parking! the room had the most comfortable bed with the most gorgeous soft luxurious sheets. They have a town car to transport you around the city, that is if you don't feel like walking as the downtown area is only about a 15 minute walk. Service and room were all above and beyond expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The little things that differentiate”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: The good: Clean, very comfortable bed, attracts nice people (no weirdos) The not so good: Very small roms (especially for the price), literally could not stand straight on to the basin for a shave. Location is a bit outside the centre up some very steep hills (NB if you are walking). Expensive restaurant (but of course you don't need to eat there. I stayed at this hotel for six days and got a relatively good rate via one of the aggregator websites. I don't know if I got a particularly small room because I wasn't paying full rate - cannot tell because I didn't see the inside of any other standard rooms. Generally I was very pleased and this review would have been a 4 or 5 star one. But hotels like The Sorrento like to tell us that it is the little details that differentiate them. Sadly my whole view of the hotel turned around within the space of a few minutes. I had made a specific point of enquiring about using the complimentary shuttle car the day before I needed it to take me to the train station. I was told explicitly that I needn't worry and I couldn't book it ahead of time, I should call back a few minutes before needing it and there wouldn't be a problem. So the next day I called up half an hour before required to try and book the shuttle only to be told that it wouldn't be available for a few hours as the car along with many others was need for a very high value client activity. So my £850 is for my stay wasn't important enough for one short journey. Up to that point The Sorrento would have featured on my list on a return to Seattle but I'm afraid that one "small" incident knocks them off my list. There are undoubtedly many fans of The Sorrento - I'm not now one of them.

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel, just a little off the beating path"”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: After staying at one hotel in Seattle, then spending two nights in Olympic National Park, my wife and I stayed at the Sorrento Hotel for two nights. We stayed in a junior suite (Room 400), which was very nice -- large and well decorated. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. The room also had nice couches where we could relax and watch television on the nice HD television. We were celebrating our anniversary and the hotel even provided us with chocolates and a bottle of wine! While staying at the Sorrento, we ate lunch at the hotel restaurant (The Hunt Club), which was very good. Even though I wanted an item that was not on the menu, the chef whipped it up for me anyway - quite impressive! The only downside, if any, was that the hotel just far enough from downtown and the water that it makes the walk back and forth somewhat of a pain (although definitely do-able). The hotel, however, has a complimentary (you must tip) Mercedes SUV that takes you within 2 miles of the hotel. Overall, a great trip and hotel. I would recommend the hotel Sorrento to couples visiting Seattle. If available, ask for room 400!

Reviews.Title: “Blew Me Away”
Reviews.Author: C_DeVan
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed at: Staff was over-the-top helpful from reservation to car service to check out. The bed was the best bed I've ever slept in. The ambiance from the courtyard to the lobby to my room, made a boring business trip something to smile about. (Really - I literally did smile!) I'll never stay at another hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Southpass_TN
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in the First Hill area of Seattle. Staff were exceptional; the bed might be the best ever; facilities were spotless. I don't think I would every stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: k5_85
Reviews.Content: The beds and pillows were the most comfortable we've ever slept on. Staff was very warm and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - once upon a time”
Reviews.Author: Perrett-traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sorrento several times over the years but must admit this year will probably be the last time. It is showing its age and while I once thought it was a nice somewhat quaint hotel that is no longer the case. The location is so-so: for better and for worse away from busy downtown downtown Seattle (on the edge of Capital Hill or in the midst of 'Pill Hill" - near three major hospitals.) There are relatively few restaurants nearby and the one in the Sorrento (Hunt Club) is fine but a bit too old-fashioned for us (and we are in our early 60's). The rooms are fine but nothing special and that is kind of what I would say about the entire establishment...OK but nothing out of the ordinary (plus or minus.)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful night in an elegant room!”
Reviews.Author: ilorien
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a night in one of the suites. All the basics met or exceeded our expectations and there were plenty of fun extras as well (french press for making coffee, rather than a typical coffee maker; good quality coffee from a small roaster, rather than the typical S***bucks crap; two large-screen TVs; plenty of seating in the sitting room). One thing to bear in mind is that (as far as we could tell), there's only one very small and very slow elevator. My wife and I are stairs people, so we weren't particularly troubled, but I can see how this might be an inconvenience for obligate elevator users.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: HHarwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is terrific. The staff - the concierge, front desk and everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful and went above/beyond to ensure the guests were happy. The room was spacious and comfortable and overall the hotel had a 'class' about it that separates it from other hotels. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle. It is hands-down my favorite hotel in Seattle and one of my overall favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenweiss
Reviews.Content: We loved the spaciousness of the rooms, the friendly staff, the ambiance, and the bakery across the street. We were disappointed by how little was in the vicinity of the hotel. Long walk or ride to any restaurants, shops, attractions, or anything worth seeing. The hospital is bounded by a freeway, a hospital, and some residences.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FROM START TO FINISH!”
Reviews.Author: runner4466
